utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: A short time ago in an apartment in Pasadena….

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: THE BIG BANG THEORY

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: EPISODE 194

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: THE OPENING NIGHT EXCITATION

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: It is a period of great tension. Our heroes, Leonard, Sheldon, Wolowitz and Koothrappali know that tickets to the new Star Wars movie are about to be available for pre-sale.

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: If they fail in their mission and can’t see it on opening night Sheldon has sworn that they will never hear the end of it for the rest of their lives…

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: They believe him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Guys, tickets already went on sale.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They’re not supposed to be available yet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know what to tell you, but they’re on sale.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait. You’re sure they’re Star Wars tickets?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s Steel Magnolias 2: Even Steelier.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The Web site’s frozen. I can’t get in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Same here!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Guys, they’re gonna sell out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are we gonna do?!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, this goes against everything I stand for, but desperate times call for desperate measures. Lord, this is Sheldon Cooper. You’re good friends with my mom. I know I’ve spent my life denying that you exist.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Got ’em.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I will continue to do so!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m really happy you and Amy are back together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m also really happy, but I can’t pretend it’s for you. New Star Wars in three days.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, Thursday can’t get here soon enough. I’m taking off work to watch the original trilogy while I eat enough Star Wars cereal to choke a Wookiee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, sweetie, you do realize Thursday is Amy’s birthday.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you do realize I bought my ticket when Amy and I were broken up? I hope you didn’t need anything in that case, ’cause it’s closed.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You guys just got back together. You might not want to ditch her on her birthday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think Penny has a point. You can see it another day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But someone might spoil the movie. No one can spoil Amy’s birthday for me. Surprise, she’s even older. Who saw that coming?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw, that’s nice. Put that on her cake.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Oh, great. This again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Arthur, what brings you back?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Uh, beats me. I, I just hope this isn’t a, a sex dream.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In the past, you’ve come to me when I’m struggling with a dilemma.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: And, and the one time where, where you were afraid, and you needed me for, for a night light. What’s, what’s troubling you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, my friends are telling me I shouldn’t abandon my girlfriend on her birthday to see the new Star Wars movie.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, sounds right. Can, can I get out of this muumuu now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Those are the robes of the Jedi, the guardians of peace and justice in the galaxy.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: And they, they, they don’t wear underwear.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, you agree with my friends that I should skip the premiere?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Uh, do, do you love this girl?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. But she knows how important Star Wars is to me.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, maybe you should show her how, how important she is to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: By seeing the movie she’d want me to see?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Sheldon, you, you can see this movie whenever you want. But you only have a limited number of days that you, you can be with this woman. Be with her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re right.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I don’t know, but hopefully, somewhere I can wear pants.

utterance.speaker: Amy (answering phone)
utterance.content: Sheldon, what’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wanted to let you know I’ll be spending your birthday with you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See, I, I had tickets to the Star Wars premiere that night, but Professor Proton came to me in a dream dressed as Obi-Wan Kenobi and convinced me I should be with you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Obi-what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll, I’ll let you get back to sleep now. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. Good night. Wait. Um, Sheldon, were you actually not gonna spend my birthday with me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s late. Got to go. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good for Sheldon deciding to stay with Amy on her birthday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. It’s still gonna be weird to see the movie without him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, we could wait a couple days and see it together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. We’re going to the comic book store. You want to come?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I can’t. I need to make preparations for Amy’s birthday. Which leads me to the following bit of business. This is my ticket to Star Wars. I don’t have to tell you it is worth far more than its face value of fifteen dollars and fifty cents. I trust you’ll give it to someone worthy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You got it. Well, Penny might want to join us.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (to Howard)
utterance.content: This is my ticket to Star Wars….

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. Penny. Penny.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What happens if I say, come in?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, find out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bernadette. Bernadette. Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Keep it up. I got nowhere else to be.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Just come in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For future reference, if I want to watch Mean Girls, I’ll stream it on Netflix.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re sorry. What do you need?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, as you know, I’ll be celebrating Amy’s birthday with her, and I could use your assistance in helping me select the perfect gift.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, so far, I’ve come up with three ideas. The first is a chance for her to play the harp with the L.A. Philharmonic.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. You can really arrange that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I said a chance, you know. When you tell them it’s your birthday at Bennigan’s, they make a fuss. I don’t see why the Philharmonic would be any different.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How about something a little more realistic?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, Amy enjoys knitting her own sweaters, so I was thinking of getting her an all-expense-paid trip to the Wisconsin Sheep and Wool Festival.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry. I was waiting for the bazinga.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hold on. It could be romantic. The two of them away together, keeping each other warm in snowy Wisconsin.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. She’d be going alone. Well, if you think I’m afraid of birds, you should see me around sheep.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, what’s the third option?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That I have coitus with her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you think about giving Sheldon’s ticket to Stuart?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know. Have you ever seen a movie with Stuart before?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s like going with your grandpa. Instead of eating popcorn, he brings little pieces of chicken in Tupperware and a thermos full of soup.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s not that bad. Hey, Stuart, got any plans Thursday night?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: My, uh, my doctor’s worried about my circulation, so I was thinking about walking around the mall. Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Wil Wheaton
utterance.content: Hey, you guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, make sure to wear sensible shoes. Wil, want to go to Star Wars Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Fine, take Wil. See if he brings you clam chowder.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, okay, okay, okay, okay. Let’s, let’s, let’s just recap our options. All right, we’ve got harp thing, sheep thing.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wild thang.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Which do you think she’d prefer? Because I checked the Sheep and Wool Festival Web site, and there’s only 8,000 tickets left.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, being physical with Amy is a huge step for you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, are you ready for this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Intimacy in any form has been challenging for me, but I’d like to show her how important she is, and it feels like now might be the right time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, that’s so beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then it’s settled. Amy’s birthday present will be my genitals.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thanks for taking me out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you’re spending your birthday with Sheldon. Why not celebrate early?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So where do you want to go?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I heard that new Mexican place on Green Street is good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure, sure. Or we could take you to get a bikini wax.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why would I get a bikini wax for my birthday?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t know. It was just a thought.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think I’ll just stick to Mexican.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Great. And then maybe after, we can watch a dirty movie, and if anybody has any questions about what happened or how, we can answer them.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, what is going on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, we just want you to be prepared for any surprises that might happen tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What surprises?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We don’t want to spoil anything, but you should know that Sheldon said he’s ready to be physical.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You shut your damn mouth. You actually heard him say this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes. He said he wants to do something to show you how much you mean to him.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I, I can’t believe it. I, I don’t know what to say.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, we’re really happy for you, and we know how much he cares…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I do know what to say. Let’s get me waxed.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Why isn’t it ever Angie Dickinson’s bedroom?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re back.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: It, it doesn’t seem like it’s up to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose you’re here because I’ve decided to be physical with my girlfriend, and I’ve never done that before.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Eh, excuse me for a moment. Well, it was worth a shot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, can you help me?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Uh, all right. Um, once, once the man gets the, the woman out of her, out of her bloomers…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no. Not that. I, I understand the mechanics.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Oh, good, good. ‘Cause, uh, I have no idea what kids these days are calling their, their parts.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think they say junk.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: What is happening to this world? What, what do you actually need to know?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is an important night for us, and I’m worried I might be overwhelmed and ruin everything.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Sheldon, if, if you’re with the right person, it, it’ll be okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you, Arthur. You are the wisest of the wise.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, that’s, that’s very nice of you to say, but I think I’m just an expression of, of your unconscious mind.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, sure. Well, you’re fun to look at.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Tonight’s the night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, the wait is finally over.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know. Then you’ll finally stop talking about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Let’s do this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Have fun, guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We will.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t believe Sheldon gave this up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re gonna have so much more fun than him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, they’re not.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Knowing them, they will.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: T minus 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, did you hear from Wil?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s on his way. Time for bladder check.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Check.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Check.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check. Wait. Screw it. I’m holding it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What is everyone booing at?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hey, guys. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, hey, Wil. What you doin’?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: I was on Star Trek. Just rooting for the home team.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Star Trek stinks!

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Yeah? Live long and suck it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Birthday girl. Birthday girl. Birthday girl.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. Sorry I’m late. I also got you a balloon, but it floated away, and I chased it for a while.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s okay. Come on in. Thank you. Um, I’ll, I’m gonna go put these in water.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Ooh, this is different, hmm? Candles and music.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you like it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s kind of spooky.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I can change it back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, no. It’s your birthday. As long as no one jumps out in a hockey mask, I’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, what’d you have in mind for tonight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought I could take you out to a nice birthday dinner. If we pick a place east of here, we might find the balloon.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Um, that sounds nice, but I’m not really hungry right now. I thought maybe we could do presents first.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. All right. Um. I should probably tell you something about this gift.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You mean before you give it to me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. May I ask you a question before I give it to you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why are we saying give it to you like that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I know your present is for us to be intimate tonight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see. Is that all right? I’m sorry, but this is a litigious society. I’m gonna need verbal consent.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what, let me pull a quick contract off the Internet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, if you don’t like Star Wars, why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Oh, I’m just having fun. Everyone takes Star Wars so seriously. Like if the movie’s bad, it’s gonna ruin their lives.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is it bad? Did you hear something? Oh, my God. It’s bad. Somebody kill me.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: See? That’s what I mean. When you wake up in the morning, whether this is the greatest movie ever or a total piece of crap, your life isn’t gonna change at all.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. No matter what happens, we’re coming back tomorrow to watch it again.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you think Sheldon’s actually gonna go through with it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. He said he’s ready.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, but he also swore this was the year he’d be able to pull the guts out of a pumpkin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’m gonna stay positive. I mean, we talked, I told him what women like, and after he stopped giggling, he seemed pretty sure of himself.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, um, should I get under the covers with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why are you shaking? Are you cold?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m just, um, really nervous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I’ve been waiting for this for so long, I’ve just built it up in my head. I don’t know what to expect.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Neither do I. But we can find out together.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m really nervous.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know. We’ve been waiting so long for this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And we’ve built it up in our heads so much.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Guys, it’s just a movie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s right.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It is.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Although, we all remember Jar Jar.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Leonard, I, I’m scared again.

utterance.speaker: Caption
utterance.content: A few hours later, in a bedroom not far away….

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I enjoyed that more than I thought I would.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I look forward to your next birthday when we do it again.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That works for me.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: I enjoyed that more than I thought I would.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t think I can walk right now.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Uh, Sheldon? Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Arthur. What are you doing here? I, I don’t think I need any more advice.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I, I was just curious. How, how’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. It was amazing. I, I saw it a few days later. What a movie.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: But, uh, what, what about Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Uh, uh, she liked it fine. But she doesn’t have the history with the franchise I do.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Okay. Good, good talk.
